result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Matthew S. Voight

records.addlTxt: Defendant Matthew S. Voight in court, in custody.  Attorney Steven C. Spear in court for Matthew S. Voight.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court by JJ Crawford. Matter before the Court for plea and sentencing as to all files. **SEE ATTACHED MINUTE SHEET**
Signature bond filed with the court. Defendant refused to sign.

BOND TO COVER 22GF1023, 22CF530, 22CF411, 22CF234, 21CF111, 22CF232, & 22CF311

DEFENDANT MUST POST $2000 CASH
DEFENDANT MUST COMPLY WITH PRETRIAL SERVICES. Contact with victim as permitted in 22CV177. Defendant may contact victim through phone calls or text messages while defendant is in custody. Defendant shall not possess or consume alcohol. Defendant shall not possess or use illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia. Defendant will not possess any firearms, ammunition or other weapons. Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH R.F. (dob 1/6/1982) OR RESIDENCE. Defendant shall personally ensure that payments are made under any Order for Income Withholding if the Court appoints an attorney for the defendant.
22-4625

Defendant Matthew S Voight in court, in custody by video. Andrew Herrmann appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Mackenzie Renner appeared. Court inquired if victim wished to be heard; no statement made. Total bond set with cash component of $2000. Same prior conditions. Minutes filed.
Hearing scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 01:15 pm.
